channel.title: Domain to 000webhost
channel.description: Ok, so Frank bought a domain on Namecheap and we would like to use it on our 000webhost account. How might we go about doing this?

item.title: Domain to 000webhost
item.dc:creator: @TheAmmoBandit TheAmmoBandit
item.description:
@TheAmmoBandit wrote:

Forgot to mention that you need to add it to Add-on Domain aswell. (Found under Domains in 000webhost CPanel)

Read full topic

item.title: Domain to 000webhost
item.dc:creator: @BronzeScape BronzeScape
item.description:
@BronzeScape wrote:

Okay, Explain More USELESS!

Read full topic

item.title: Domain to 000webhost
item.dc:creator: @Ecko Ecko
item.description:
@Ecko wrote:

It should be an Add On domain, not a Parked domain.

Read full topic

item.title: Domain to 000webhost
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“KroniKz_, post:9, topic:462883”][quote author=TheAmmoBandit link=topic=566127.msg4117691#msg4117691 date=1349251272]
No, just need the domain parked on the site you want and the nameservers updated at namecheap wich i assume you’ve done.

Changes take 24H to apply, let me know if you need any other help
[/quote]
Yes I do, thanks to you the site motionlessgaming.info proceeds to motionlessgaming.hostoi.com

but now my problem is, it is acting as a redirect. I want it to be a .info all the time, what should I do?[/quote]
Isnt There A “URL Cloak” Or something when you register it? If there is, click that and it should work

Read full topic

item.description:

[quote=“TheAmmoBandit, post:8, topic:462883”]No, just need the domain parked on the site you want and the nameservers updated at namecheap wich i assume you’ve done.

Changes take 24H to apply, let me know if you need any other help[/quote]
Yes I do, thanks to you the site motionlessgaming.info proceeds to motionlessgaming.hostoi.com

but now my problem is, it is acting as a redirect. I want it to be a .info all the time, what should I do?

Read full topic

item.title: Domain to 000webhost

item.description:
@TheAmmoBandit wrote:

No, just need the domain parked on the site you want and the nameservers updated at namecheap wich i assume you’ve done.

Changes take 24H to apply, let me know if you need any other help

Read full topic

item.title: Domain to 000webhost
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

Note that sometimes it’s not instant, and may take a moment. And also, if you don’t mind me asking… How much did you pay for the domain?

Read full topic

item.title: Domain to 000webhost
item.dc:creator: @kronixz kronikz
item.description:
@kronixz wrote:

[quote=“TheAmmoBandit, post:5, topic:462883”][quote author=KroniKz_ link=topic=566127.msg4117361#msg4117361 date=1349210748]
hi i is frank (dolan)

I bought a domain, and used the account details on webhost to use. the “name servers”
000webhost gave me 2 name servers
something like Ns01.000webhost.com
and ns02.000webhost.com
I put them in on namecheap but the domain doesnt work

www.motionlessgaming.info
(doesnt work)
[/quote]Hello, i register all my domains at namecheap so i can help.

Go To NameCheap and login. Go to Manage Domains and click on the domain. Click on Domain Name Setup and fill in the nameserverd of 000webhost: ns01.000webhost.com and ns02.000webhost.com

Now go to 000webhost and login, you should see Parked Domains, click on it.
Fill in the domain you bought, (http://domainname.com) and save the settings.

Allow the servers to update, this can take 24H

That should do it ;)[/quote]
Domain motionlessgaming.has been parked on top of motionlessgaming.hi.com. The most important thing is that now you need to update nameservers of domain motionlessgaming.** to ns01.000webhost.com, ns02.000webhost.com

alright now what, i alread added the name servers to namecheap, anywhere else?

Read full topic

item.title: Domain to 000webhost
item.dc:creator: @TheAmmoBandit TheAmmoBandit
item.description:
@TheAmmoBandit wrote:

[quote=“KroniKz_, post:2, topic:462883”]hi i is frank (dolan)

I bought a domain, and used the account details on webhost to use. the “name servers”
000webhost gave me 2 name servers
something like Ns01.000webhost.com
and ns02.000webhost.com
I put them in on namecheap but the domain doesnt work

www.motionlessgaming.info
(doesnt work)[/quote]Hello, i register all my domains at namecheap so i can help.

Go To NameCheap and login. Go to Manage Domains and click on the domain. Click on Domain Name Setup and fill in the nameserverd of 000webhost: ns01.000webhost.com and ns02.000webhost.com

Now go to 000webhost and login, you should see Parked Domains, click on it.
Fill in the domain you bought, (http://domainname.com) and save the settings.

Allow the servers to update, this can take 24H

That should do it

Read full topic

item.title: Domain to 000webhost

item.description:
@kronixz wrote:

provided an IP adress, it’s not accepting it.

Read full topic

item.title: Domain to 000webhost
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

You should make sure the NameServers are correct, if this is still an issue try providing the IP Address if it asks for it.

If issues still occur contact 000webhost.com

Read full topic
